title: Adult Beginner Session Structure
summary: A 2-hour session structure focused on injury prevention, fundamentals, and enjoyment.
goals: Reduce injury risk through safe preparation.
Introduce one focused technique per session.
Build muscle memory with multi-shuttle repetition.
Learn basic footwork for efficient movement.
Apply skills in a low-pressure game setting.

structure.title: Warm-up & Activation (15 min)
items: Light jogging or skipping to raise the pulse.
Dynamic stretching: arm circles, leg swings, torso twists.
Emphasize smooth movements; avoid sudden jerks.

structure.title: Fundamental Technique Instruction (20 min)
items: Introduce one specific skill (e.g., forehand grip and high serve).
Show the swing path without the shuttle.
Explain the why and how; players shadow-swing with corrections.

structure.title: Multi-shuttle Drills / Skill Practice (40 min)
items: Static feeds to a target area.
Focus on contact point, timing, and grip transition.
Rotate players frequently for age-appropriate rest.

structure.title: Footwork & Movement Basics (20 min)
items: Slow shadow footwork to the 4 corners.

structure.title: Fun Games / Controlled Sparring (15 min)
items: "King of the Court" with simplified rules.

structure.title: Stretching & Stretching (10 min)
items: Static stretching for hamstrings, calves, shoulders, and forearms.

drills.name: Static multi-shuttle feed
notes: Feed to a fixed target area.

drills.name: Four-corner shadow footwork
notes: Move at a slow pace first.
Return to base after each corner.

coachingNotes: Explain the why and how with short, clear cues.
Correct form during shadow swings before adding the shuttle.
Rotate players to keep rest intervals comfortable.
safety: Keep movements smooth; avoid sudden jerks.
Protect knees during lunges with controlled alignment.
Adjust rest intervals for adult beginners.
